title: ejd59005
author: ejd59005
content: Hi all,I'm interested in selling my 2014 Casascius Bitcoin Bowl coin. It's still in the original slab from Mike in 2014.  2,000 were originally produced but Mike scrapped 1,150 of them (due to quality of the slab which tarnished the coins). This left 850 of the coins in the wild. Original post here: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=903503.msg10956463#msg10956463I'm interested in selling mine. Looking for BTC only. Pictures below.

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: Would love to add it to the rest of my bitcoin bowl items but usually this coin is way out of my range - curious to see what offers you get.

comments.author: Fattcatt
comments.body: What are you looking to get for it? Ungraded?   I'm interested

comments.author: ejd59005
comments.body: Quote from: Fattcatt on September 25, 2022, 04:32:43 PMWhat are you looking to get for it? Ungraded?   I'm interested  I'm honestly not sure really. I've checked around the forum and last couple sales I saw went for around $1,200 in BTC. I may put mine up for auction.

comments.author: Ballhog69
comments.body: You will find its real current value in an auction, Goodluck with your sales

comments.author: ejd59005
comments.body: Thanks. I think I’m going to go that route here soon.

comments.author: icey
comments.body: Watching with interest, don't see these come up often at all.

comments.author: DebitMe
comments.body: I would offer $900 in btc plus escrow and shipping?

comments.author: ejd59005
comments.body: Quote from: ejd59005 on September 25, 2022, 09:28:36 PMCurrent best offer $1,500 btcI'm unable to reply to all PM's at the moment since my account is new, but current offer is $1,600Thanks!

comments.author: owlcatz
comments.body: Quote from: ejd59005 on September 26, 2022, 12:36:44 AMI'm unable to reply to all PM's at the moment since my account is new, but current offer is $1,600Thanks! Always an option... https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2385104.msg24371150#msg24371150Edit nvm, I thought it removed your pm limits, sorry!

comments.author: LoyceV
comments.body: Quote from: ejd59005 on September 26, 2022, 12:36:44 AMI'm unable to reply to all PM's at the moment since my account is newI've whitelisted you, you should be able to respond to your PMs again.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: Quote from: ejd59005 on September 26, 2022, 11:57:46 AMCurrent highest offer is $1,650. Any idea when you’ll be ending the blind auction? Do you have a price in mind or a set day that you are going to declare a winner? Just curious as I’d like to see what this sells for when the dust settles. Good luck with your sale and congrats on the success of your taking offers via PM. I’ll be awaiting the outcome and watching.

comments.author: ejd59005
comments.body: Quote from: OgNasty on September 26, 2022, 05:10:59 PMQuote from: ejd59005 on September 26, 2022, 11:57:46 AMCurrent highest offer is $1,650. Any idea when you’ll be ending the blind auction? Do you have a price in mind or a set day that you are going to declare a winner? Just curious as I’d like to see what this sells for when the dust settles. Good luck with your sale and congrats on the success of your taking offers via PM. I’ll be awaiting the outcome and watching. Thanks for the interest, but I think I'm going to open it up and run a full public auction. Details to follow.

comments.author: Spokanistan51
comments.body: Some advice for people that have these, it seems the slabs with the rubber insert holders may make these tarnish pretty badly (I had same holder for mine). It may be in your best interest to swap them out for a foam surround or fitted plastic.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: Quote from: ejd59005 on September 26, 2022, 05:13:15 PMQuote from: OgNasty on September 26, 2022, 05:10:59 PMQuote from: ejd59005 on September 26, 2022, 11:57:46 AMCurrent highest offer is $1,650. Any idea when you’ll be ending the blind auction? Do you have a price in mind or a set day that you are going to declare a winner? Just curious as I’d like to see what this sells for when the dust settles. Good luck with your sale and congrats on the success of your taking offers via PM. I’ll be awaiting the outcome and watching. Thanks for the interest, but I think I'm going to open it up and run a full public auction. Details to follow. Don't take too long.  I'm considering selling mine as well but don't want to steal your thunder.  Spokanistan51 also makes a great point about these coins.  The slabs they were shipped in are terrible.  I understand collector's like to hold the coins in their originally shipped packaging, but in this case I think you'd be better off not doing that.  You have to remember that when Casascius was making these types of coins, BTC was much cheaper and there was probably not much thought put into things like packaging.

comments.author: ejd59005
comments.body: Quote from: OgNasty on September 28, 2022, 09:34:08 PMQuote from: ejd59005 on September 26, 2022, 05:13:15 PMQuote from: OgNasty on September 26, 2022, 05:10:59 PMQuote from: ejd59005 on September 26, 2022, 11:57:46 AMCurrent highest offer is $1,650. I’ll be awaiting the outcome and watching. Thanks for the interest, but I think I'm going to open it up and run a full public auction. Details to follow. Don't take too long.  I'm considering selling mine as well but don't want to steal your thunder.  Spokanistan51 also makes a great point about these coins.  The slabs they were shipped in are terrible.  I understand collector's like to hold the coins in their originally shipped packaging, but in this case I think you'd be better off not doing that.  You have to remember that when Casascius was making these types of coins, BTC was much cheaper and there was probably not much thought put into things like packaging. Working on the details of the auction. Coming soon

comments.author: minerjones
comments.body: This coin is now for auction: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5415842
